content: Good story, i seen literally one type of sympathy missing the p early on, only noticed because i replayed heaps of times to get as good ending as i could
Good interactive novel with an interesting plot.
Superb story and very well written. Numerous paths provide a lot of replay value.
Amazing game the ending is very difficult so be ready for a challenge but overall an amazing game
I simply Love it nothing more to say
Great game
Too much reading, as for a reader such as myself, I find it too much to read
I love this game, hope more game like this
Great story. Very well written.

What can I say the game was good the lore was really expanded upon the characters well written and the writing is amazing your choices do matter the only reason why I gave it four stars is that I found it pretty short but I would say it's totally worth it for the second game i totally recommend it specially if your a fan of hosted games.
It was a good game, played it multiple times to find the endings and so on, but when is Lord's of Infinity coming out ?
Amazing üëè
Not many choices pretty short not seeing the appeal I guess the fact that you can actually lose is nice but the game is too short
Great game. Really well written.
Incredible writing.

While it'd be smarter to have a preview, I have to say the sheer number of positive reviews is quite the motivating factor in purchasing this gem of a book. It is full of action and character, and it perfectly catches the tone of powder and blade warfare.
Thoroughly enjoyable!

A great narrative-driven game based on the height of gunpowder in a fictional version of the world. I like how the author went low magic on this one and lets the soldering aspects take precedent, as this is really what its all about. I would recommend this to any fans of choice games.
Can't wait for the third in the series! One of the best out there!

I can't say how many times I have replayed the story since I've had Sabres of Infinity over the last six months. Unlike every other intereactive novel I have, which usually becomes boring after the first play-through, this novel has kept me hooked. It has a depth to it that isn't just about warfare, it's about eveything around warfare and a deeper coverage of the psychological aspects of war. The writing is exceptional. You can be whatever kind of officer you care to be. I look forward to lords.

I feel that the warning about being limited to playing a male character should have been given before purchasing. I understand the reasoning as stated - but it was a disappointment not to have the option for me and so I refunded the game and returned it. I feel that even in a restrictive setting there could be ways to allow for this however and it was alienating.
Amazing!
Probably on of the best interactive novels out there
One of the best game series ever. Worth every penny jump in and fight for glory and victory!!

Boy, oh boy, do I love this game. The world had a phenomenal amount of depth and building and I felt incredibly immersed. Every single one of my decisions seemed to hold actual weight. I felt genuine anxiety over whether or not I'd made a good choice or not - and that is just some glorious writing. I also ended up restarting far too many times in hope of sparing the lives of my fictional soldiers. I got way too attached. You also can choose if you want to be a total sociopath or not! It's great.
Seems nice, but I got bored from lack of choices. It wasn't as interactive as other games they've made.
This interactive novel is something you need to think over again so you would be satisfied in the ending.

Way too much reading with very little player/character choice. You could spend 30 minutes between segments of the story just reading before you are given any options to shape your character/story. Which after a time can become boring when you want to be able to make decisions/choices of your own. The story is good, but when you want to actually play the "game" it gets annoying after awhile.

So far I've played through this one twice, just now finishing the second playthrough. I highly recommend this game to anyone who loves a novel with proper description or one that describes life at war. Very well done.
pretty good cyoa game might get the sequel
One of my favourite best series. Exciting adventurous engaging story. Great work author. Keep it up

An excellent beginning to "The Inifinity Saga", extremely well-written and constructed. If you enjoy this, check out the sequel, Guns of Infinity. The author, Paul "Cataphrak" Wang, is currently in the process of writing the third installment, Lords of Infinity, which is now open to a public beta/trial and I can't wait!
great story
love it
worth the cost, could use more options to shape your character, but no less a great game.
One of the best stories I have read that uses the choose your own adventure format.It is well worth your money !
You need to read this series!
Much better than most "Choose your own adventure" stories via app form. I can't wait to continue my progress in its sequel, "Gins of Infinity"!
I love this game. Not only is the story good but the lore is equally good.
My absolute favorite from both Choice of and Hosted games. The narrative is amazing and the choices have a concrete feel of consequence to them
had a lot of fun with this one
Without doubt, worth the money.

This game has set THE standard for what every other interactive novel should strive to be. I cannot believe, nor can I explain or give enough praise, to the masterful writing and immersive story crafted here.
love it. enough said.
Engrossing from start to finish. I absolutely loved it and would highly recommend it to pretty much anyone. Buying the sequel right now of it's out.
Fantastic book!! Definetly one of the must haves from Choice of Games!
This game is my absolute favorite. Can't wait for more.

Terrific game. Gritty detail, good characters (notably Cazarosta), and the author slips in some clever self-reference in the "sabres" speech. Challenging but fun to survive the cataclysmic battle at the end.
more dignified, better written and more entertaining than a lot of the tedious high fantasy titles in hosted games.

Obviously, it's a text based game so don't expect wicked graphics. But damn it's an amazing game that draws you in with it's own lore and it's so cool! Well worth the cash to buy it and I'm looking forward to "Guns of Infinity" the sequel for this - makes me want to buy all their games... Absolute 10/10!

Came out well before it's time. Amazing game and stands at the top with 
other titles like: Choice of Rebels and I Cyborg. Great game
One of the best e books out there very engaging and well worth the cost

Amazing in evreyway a breath taking story that keeps you on your toes well 
written and cant wait for book number 2

Nice story, loved it, but not being able to chose my gender was a bit 
disappointing. I get it, realism and circumstance in this time period 
causes this but I would've liked a heads up before buying this.

Brilliantly written and the story is amazing, kept me occupied for hours 
trying out all the choices can't wait for more. I don't agree with what 
people are saying about a save point the point of this game is that your 
choices effect your outcome and that changes how the story proceeds whether 
you survive or die is due to your choices.
Great Game
A top tier choice story

Brilliant game! Once you accept that this game focuses entirely on the 
military and war, it draws you in completely. Very well written, 
emotionally and intellectually engaging. I can highly recommend it!
Loved it
One of the best CoGs around!
I love this its one of the best choice game's i have ever installed and played
Great game can't wait for the third one.
Great writing, great book, great review.

Easily one of CoG's best games. This author is talented and wrote an engrossing story and the skills can easily balance out if you balance your choices. You won't be an unstoppable swordsmen but you won't be stupid either. I know it's possible from experience. It's all about how you choose to play. And that comes with consequence in the game and it's sequels

I loved this story. It's not so much of a game as much as it's a novel. The fact that the main character and other characters can be hurt or killed based on your decisions really attaches you to the characters in a way that a traditional novel can. Paul Wang is a great author on top of all the technical elements which brings everything together for a wonderful experience. Paul has really succeeded in created a world that I truly want to continue exploring.
It is an amazing story. Although I didn't like most of the endings but after going through numerous times I found an amazing ending I liked.
Immersive, masterfully crafted and very compelling. Live and experience the life of a Napoleonesque cavalry officer! Whether triumph or failure, this game is a must have :)
Where is lords of infinity? I want to know what happens after this so good

It is certainly one of the best story games I ranked as the best that I played so far. It really had me using my brain too be not only the best Soldier I can be, but be the best Commander I can be to my troops as well as come up with the best route of action to succeed in battle to try to come out with least casualties and high reputation to be known by fellow soldiers and commanders and even the King himself, being knighted a Knight of the Red was one of the best awards I could receive and even better carrying that honor during the second sequel. Cheers for the author of this story
The story is cool and all. But this is not my first GoC game, the interaction with other characters can be improved.
Really exellent game still holds up after years since i last played it
One of the best.

This. Was freaking. Awesome. Now if Hosted Games could make a text-based version of the novel The Count Of Monte Cristo by Alexandre Dumas,  where you can play as the Count/Edmond Dant√®s, that would be REALLY REALLY awesome, even more awesome than this game, in fact! Oh please make it happen, Hosted Games, pppllleeeaaassseee!!!
The best hosted games story yet
Read then you will understand.
More information on personal would be nice
I thoroughly enjoyed playing this game. Great story and characters. I highly recomend playing this game.

I've been itching for a good interactive novel since I read Life of a Mobster, Magikaras and Mecha Ace. I was hesitant to buy this at first but I'm really glad I did and I can't wait to read the next installment. 10 Stars!!!! Really Amazing Read Thx :) Bout to buy the next one now and start reading it :D
Loved this so much. It felt like being in control of a great book.

One of the best CYOA games on the market, up there with new classics like Choice of Robots.  Notably, shies away from activism and forced romances in favor of consequential choices and kick ass action scenes.  If you like games like this, you'll love this one.
Awesome and long enough story, nice alternate endings. Can't wait for a 3rd episode !
Waste of time and money

As with all games of this type, the quality of writing is paramount. And in this case, the writing does not disappoint, as it brings to mind the Napoleonic sagas of Sharpe and Horblower. Excellent work - I'm moving on to "Guns" with a big smile on my face and eager to see what the future holds for my not-so-young Captain.
Excellent story highly interactive gameplay. Five stars

Very good detailed story coupled with an extensive historical context with in game references to boot! Totally immersive and addicting. Alot of reading though and the choices are really nail biting. I was stuck at some points really thinking thru before i made a choice. Kudos to the author!

Want to play a balanced character? Forget about it.  You have three options: 1. Strong Rambo Combat Master thats dumb as a rock and unpopular 2. Genius Tactician weakling nerd outcast 3. Hollywood Celebrity Officer thats weak and braindead  Did you choose an option thats not your strength? Well guess what now your reputation is 0% and we will only boost it 1% if you do any heroic acts the rest of the game.  This is a GREAT series. I have played sabre and guns, and will play Lords. But it is absolutely impossible to create a character that is balanced, or even overpowered. Rated 1 star because this criticism needs to be seen
I greatly enjoyed the story. I'm sure I will play this many times to see what else could happen.
Good. However the whole magic crap and then the banes etc, etc. A bit hard to follow with the magic involved other than that quite good.

This starts you exactly where you need to be and let's you drive through this world for good or ill.  It's something that'll tickle your fancy if you're into military jargon and love non oppressive old English.  Your choices tend to matter in ways you might not know,  but I never felt like my choices we're useless,  unless it was asking for an opinion. Otherwise I would highly recommend this if you're looking for a Choice of with actual Choice and substance to that choice.
The Hosted Games / Choice of games series don't get better than this I was totally engrossed with this story
But I hope it's good.

great game the story was not as in depth but was interactive fun and intense if you were to add a story and interaction together it would be the best but i have not seen the second yet and this was awesome i  have 25 of their games installed and have paid for five of them and when i buy games i know i will like it i support the authors and hosted games and am always glad to see a new and or good book from them! this was worth it!
Tried to thoroughly enjoy it, just like too much reading with the lacking of choices, but the parts I played were well developed.I felt as though I could have lived in the time.

Sabres of infinity is just about everything a Sharpe and Earthsea fan could want, lobbed into a healthy brew and served with a rich side of it's own world building. The writing and characters are in a tier of their own, with a sumptuously inviting lore for your character to step into and shape. The detail, terminology, and cultural perspective feel worthy of a full publish, all the better that it offers more choice and value than most of the market. Sabres is an essential purchase for the discerning reader.
Choices matter, good characters, immersive world. Realistic and gritty, with some limited magic and fantasy elements.

This is an extremely solid game and easily the most engaging of the cogs that i have played (though i have yet to try the hero rise series) very solidly written and the universe is very interesting. I will say it gets a little bit novely at times, which is to say the gap between choices is far between, but the writing is solid enough that this never really starts to grate. Overall i give this one a hearty reccomend and I'm excitedly starting the next one now.

Seems like it's had a lot expanded when it was decided it would become a series. I played it a few years ago on iPhone, I think, but played again here recently, and the sequel. Mich better even than I remember. Bravo. Only thing is I wish the expression would become "saints be blessed". Just bugs me. Had to do a mental replacement every time I come across it. But great work.
ELSON!!!!!
A must read, even the second time...
Great story

Cataphrak's first entry in the Infinity series is a marvellous piece of work that introduces you to a detailed low fantasy world heavily influenced by the Napoleonic era. There is no doubt that this is one of the best Choicescript games that has been published and I look forward to continuing the stories of my characters in the next installments.
Great writing
Needs multiple playthroughs but it is definitely worth it!!!!
Gripping story. Especially because it is continued.

This is the best series I've read from Choice of Games, there is nothing bad to say about this game, the writing is superb with great vivid detail, the story is incredible & hard not to absorb, I've read this game several times since its release and I still haven't found all the possible paths that branch out exponentially, I highly recommend you try this game out, I doubt you'll be disappointed!

You are given very little customization with your character, the game basically just gives you a guy and let's you pick what he does. This game has way too much talk, with way too little action, making it boring and drab. No matter how well you do, you make one mistake and you lose the game, it's way to hard and unforgiving for this type of game. The story, frankly, is boring with little excitement. And finally, your character only has three attributes, and you can't have a well rounded character, pick one.
Very nicely written, great story and not the least bit boring. Buy this game then buy the sequel you won't regret it.
Outstanding story and detail. My only criticism is than there could have been more reader interaction to effect the story. Looking forward to book 2.
Loved it.
Another masterpiece
Has a very unique setting as well as an engaging story.

At first I was a little frustrated when my 'sensible' choices rewarded me with an early end game, but now I've finished it (3rd time lucky), I look back and laugh at what happened in my earlier attempts. Was well worth the read and the ending was epic.
I loved it and it was longer then I thought it would be at first. Not disappointed.
this is a setting that has me hooked on hearinf it and is a very good game but it looses something towards the end becoming a times tedious.. :)
Lovely,  but can't play as a woman and that boggles me
I have read a lot of books like this and this one takes 1st place detail Given was amazing thanks for this game book and looking forward to more like it

The storyline is great and after several play through's I can assure you your choices absolutely affect the game. While playing different characters I was able to either rise to become a Captain and Red Knight or fall and become a disgraced officer. The choices are diverse and cover almost all of the possible answers I might have given. I really did care about my character and can't wait for the sequel. I do have one suggestion though, perhaps have an option to go back to your last checkpoint.
Excellent
NOICE
Haven't finished this yet but it is a good length. Some of these games are a bit short. Good storyline, great detail, top stuff all around
Great and fun read. Choices that matter. I enjoyed it immensely
I really liked the setting it didnt feel static and was rather detailed
Awesome
Can't play it its stuck on the opening picture
Great story with a new and interesting plot cant wait for the sequel.
I love the game cant wait for the new guns of infinity show up i will definitely buy it. When will the new sequel comes up?????
Cant wait for the second series
One of the best cyoa style novels I've read. Eagerly awaiting the sequel!
Plenty of variety, plenty of stats to keep in mind when making decisions, consequences for actions. Kudos, dude!
I love this story sooooooo much! Can't wait until the next book comes out
Best game on CoG

An extremely well written story, with a great deal of variety despite its close starting parameters. I can't wait for the sequel. The only one improvement I can think of would be to allow the player to go back to the previous checkpoint without having to die.
I love the CYOA books and usually am mostly dissapointed by these books because of the lack or sognificant choices but this had to be the best one i have read. I can't wait for Guns of Infinity!
I've benn waiting for the new book Gun's of Infinity for what feels like decades. Could you guys please at least give us a date of when it will be released
Amazing! Truly Amazing! Out of all of your works this was by far the best. Wondering if we can ever get a specific date on when the sequel will be out. I would hate to see the story stop here
Very good
When is the sequel coming out man? I've been replaying this game for countless times already. Let me give you my damn money damn it!!
Played thru 4 times now. Please tell me there's gonna be a sequel. WHEN IS THE SEQUEL
Looking forward to Guns of Infinity
...the next instalment coming out, I crave it?!

Quite an epic story of war. Now hailed a Hero I can't wait for the next chapter. It would be my favorite Hosted if it was complete, but as it stands it slides into 2nd place. The lack of closure prevents me from placing it at the top spot.

Love this game, big Choice of Games fan. But I've noticed that this title above the rest tend to not have as many choices and more reading than anything. I understood at the beginning when you have to play as a male but you really have little control over the story like your other games. I still love it though.
Great story and good replayability
I cannot wait for the next installment of this series. I wish there would be romance, and options for it. But I haven't come across any. Still, it is very well, put together.

Great work as I've come to expect.this writer is awesome he and the guy who does zombie exodus are the two leaders in the field imho Highly recommend. Finally finished it, incredible work! Truly brilliant. Been keeping up on the website, looks like you've got Guns about wrapped up. GIVE IT TO US ALREADY, PLEASE! LET ME GIVE YOU MY MONEYY! Phew. Sorry about that.
And I can't wait for the sequel.

Quite possibly the best choose your own adventure style game I've ever had the chance to play in my life I was just wondering if there was a sequel in the works or if this is where Wilhelm D'al Miller's story ends
No matter what I kept dying or failing. The only time I didn't die like a man was when I retreated and I still died! This game has made me more rage happy than Dark souls.
I can't wait for book 2.                              Edit: so I've learned that the 2nd book is available online, but not for the play store. What's going on?
One of the greatest choice of games stories.
My favorite Choice of Game book
When is the next part coming
When is Guns of Infinity coming out?!
Excellent history and game book! However is only the first book.
It's a great game. It's definitely my favorite CoG. I've played it multiples times over and over. Now who's gonna tell me when the sequel is coming out? I've been waiting for forever.

I first bought this game with some reservations after reading it was a military game.  Not being a huge fan of the genre, I decided to give it a shot in light of some of the positive reviews here.  To my imminent surprise, I was quickly immersed in the Kingdom of Tierra.  I loved being able to make what kind of soldier my character would become, a intelligent young man of quick thinking, honor and military strategy.  The best game Cataphrak ever released, I truly look forward to the release of the sequel!
Great game I just wish you could choose a weapon of preference to make your character a bit more personal
Loved every second of this game
I saw that GOI has been made and am wondering when I can download  it off of the play store

Highly recommended to fans of CYOA or RPGs. Although it starts off slow and is honestly a bit abrassive, requiring some effort to get through its opening chapters, once it gets going it really picks up. The ending chapters are especially fantastic. Looking forward to the next entry.
Best choose your own adventure game I've yet to play. Love it I just wish the authors didn't take years to put out the sequels...

I've never been to keen on war themes but I decided to give this a try, mainly because it had magic in it too and that's always a big seller to me. But from what I read the story is well-written and very detailed. The writer put a lot of thought in creating this story and it shows. I am having a little of a hard time getting through it just because it is a war themed story but it is one I will come back to on a later date. My only complaint so far is that you go awhile before getting to make a choice.
Very sound character work and superb storytelling

I have bought just about all the hosted and choice of games titles to come out and while some are definitely let downs, others, like this, leave an extreamly satisfying taste in your mouth. I would definitely put this up in the same realm as Zombie Exodus (which ifu haven't read yet u better). Not as good but dang near close. What's more, with the sequel in the works, you won't have to wait much longer to continue from this one's ending.
Great game, cant wait for sequel
This is one of the best text based games I've played! My only complaint is that I can't wait for the sequel!
Developed, long, story driven. I only wish there was more flexibility in character creation and some more development with your men.
This game was excellent. It had a well thought out plot, and your attention was gripped throughout the whole story. An absolute must have.
Great game. Waiting for the next one!
When's the sequel?
When will the second part be out? Please release Guns of Infinity already...:-)
I enjoyed it and went through repeatedly cant wait for the sequel to be released
Can't wait for the sequel!
Just wish the second one would come out already been faithfully waiting for around 8 months now
Can't wait for the next one
Well worth the price if you're into the subject
I don't mean to discourage others from buying, personally I just didn't care for it.
-1 star for the ending
Can't wait for the sequel
Amazing im a knight and a captain cant wait for the second one.
When dose the next one come out? Because this was the best interactive story I've played

Complex world building, rich plot, deep and interesting characters -- all of these will hook you in, even if the game limits your gender due to a reason the author has stated before the start of the game. One of the must-have CoG games.
Great game I love the atmosphere great length and many choices but still a lot of reading. Cannot wait for next installment
Got a great ending very satisfied by the ending I got all together one of my favorite og the groups
Tried reboot of phone and closing apps. What the heck! Galaxy Note 3
Awesome story line good choices just love it
One of the best
Beautifully well written, battles are extremely vivid and more than most it feels like your choices have a genuine impact. Hope that sequel is still on its way!
Loved the story! The choices directly effected the outcome of the game. Loved it
Great story with a branching plot. Well worth the money and product is as advertised

Story was one of the best of choice of games, can't wait to play the second episode of this adventure. It's totally worth the buy! Even tho some people complain about long pages of reading, I found it rather interesting, and much more satisfying than making choice after every 50 words of story, I kind of got '''sucked-in'' in the story :) And it was a surprisingly LONG game compared to some others that I have tried.
Absolutely loved it. My only problem is it seems the end is either desert or die unless your military is high as possible

Kept my attention the whole way through; there are very few games out there that really make me wonder and consider my actions, leaving me excited to see the results. This is definitely one of them! Simply excellent---its long, its thought out, its entertaining, and the characters are very interesting and have distinctive personalities. The epilogue promised a sequel, and I am very much hoping there will be one!

Let it be known that the story is very good. I have read it a few times over and I'm happy with the price of the story. However that's all it is. It's not a game in the way it leads you to believe.   You can replay it, make different choices, and have changes happen. However if that is all it took to make a good game no bad games would exist.   The author has a story to tell and it will be told. However it fall short as a choose your own adventure game. Being more of an interactive book.

One of the best choice-story-games I have played! Can't wait for the continuation of it, I think I played it rhough 3 or 4 times with different personalities. It has really good language, a lot of outcomes and situations, it's very vivid and overall excellent quality. However, please take note of the author's warning in the beginning, it is indeed a story of a Napoleon wars age or something close, to be more exact, of a young gentleman on the battlefield. It doesn't provide you with artificial but rich possibilities of usual Choice-of-Games characters, but that allows the author to provide more deep characterisation and plot.

The stats are extremely informative, unique, well thought out and in depth, the diction is pretty high level, the plot is very interesting, the dialogue is engaging, the terminology is inventive and easy to get used to, and the story itself is well layered and has variety.

Great story, well told with good choices and a  solid variety of outcomes to many situations. My only gripe would be the pages and pages you sometimes have to go through before making another choice. Other than that very good, looking forward to part 2
Loved it can't wait for the next one
Just hurry and write the next. And you should add in the ability to bane cast
This is beautifully done and I'm ready to see the next part of this series! Amazing just amazing.
I think the game is great with an interesting plot and world but I can't rate it 5 stars because I detest being forced to play as a man, especially in a game I payed for.
Well written. U will get wrapped up in the story.
I love this game it has a great story and is well written.  If you like choose-your-own-adventure type games don't miss out on this one.
This was absolutely worth the three bucks. Fans of Richard Sharpe will be right at home.
A game you want to play over and over again thanks to the changes its easier to play till the end. Great story and careful choices needed what's not to like

Best in Class! This game is extremely fun to play and the endings are well thought-out. There is a way to survive until the end and I must comment that I was very connected to my character. I cannot wait for the next one!

There's nothing of the character using magic - not unless it's an obscure option I missed. The actions and even some choices are too linear. I Very disappointed. COG had some promising writers who just disappeared. Too bad.

This is a great Choice of Game it has action and adventure, magic and more. I highly reccomend this game to anyone and everyone. And if this is your first time getting a Choice of Game. Dont be afraid to pick this one because you wont be disappointed
Well written and great fun

A solid must buy game! However just how much soldiering do I need to be able to fully gallop my horse and not fail? 76 soldiering + bulwark horse = fail. 76 soldiering + thunderer = fail. 76 soldiering + govt horse = fail.

Definitely worth the cost of entry. Great story, choices that matter, and a real challenge! I would also say this ha a great replay value. I really hole there is a sequel or at least more games in this universe. I will certainly be buying what this author releases.

Great story. Great option.  Well played.  I guess this is must have hosted game. Btw better than zombie  exodus, way walker,life of mage.  Same level  with slammed.  Overall this is a great story before you sleep.
It has a very good plot.  Hope there will be an extension, like are we going to win the war or lose. I feel like Im there leading this rag tag team to victory. Can't get enough of this game.

I was really excited to see the Infinite Seas get published. I was a little anxious that adapting the plot to a game format might strain the narrative, but Paul pulled it off with utter and absolute aplomb, and I cannot wait for the other stories. Great plot and character development along with the accuracy and attention to deta I've always enjoyed in this developer's work. With the addition of a checkpoint system, any sense of tediousness has evaporated for me as well.
I have played every game in the "Hosted" version and the "real " version,  and I gotta say that it blow my expectation away!! In other words it rocks!!! ‚âßÔπè‚â¶

I gotta say, I was really put off that gender couldn't be decided in this game and the only reason I still bought it was because I thought it was cheap and it wouldn't hurt if it turned out to suck... I didn't play it for a little while after buying it, but then one day I was bored and started it... And I was absolutely blown away! I honestly can't get enough of it. I can't even tell you how many times I have played it now, trying out different builds. I really(x5) look forward to the next book!
Seriously, one of the best games I have ever played. I can't wait for the sequel

Excellent story, but a bit frustrated at having to start from the very beginning after one wrong choice quite late in the game. It would be nice if you could at least restart a chapter. Will up to 5 stars if this gets implemented.  Edit - Chapter save has now been added! Many thanks to the author. Five stars for a vivid and brilliantly conceived CYOA story. Can't wait for part two!
Love the world building in this game. The characters are well written and the plot is interesting. I look forward to more tales set in the Infinite Sea.
Nice writting and a in depth world setting will keep you glued. My own problem is the lack of being a bane caster yourself.
Dang this game is the illest text based game ever..and I've played and bought a few..just dope, totally worth it

It took me 3 tries before finally completing it. A certain choice at the end kept resulting in my death which caused me to start over from the beginning which was tad annoying. Other than needing a save/checkpoint system of some sort, overall it was an enjoyable experience. Buy it! :P

The game is hard but addictive. Trying a different combination creates very different results, often the death of your character and then you spend the next 5 minutes skipping to pages to get to the choices.

When I think of interactive fiction, I look at things from my youth: CYOA novels, video games and role-playing. As a relatively sparse source of media, interactive fiction distinguishes itself from visual novels and other methods due to the dependence of good exposition and description.  In the case of Sabres of Infinity, it uses this dependence as its strength. Places in the game are notably detailed, characters are fleshed out and the plot takes many turns. In the opening chapter, this is done to a tee, where you see the observations of characters, and then decide whether duty really is more important. The conflict of choices is relevant, and though there are optimal playthroughs, the failures are accented and interesting. Each of the story arcs have high and low points, but due to the replay potential of the game, one learns more about details that are left out from prior playthroughs.  My few gripes about the game are the occasional syntax error and the "roguelike" playthrough system, but the system does place more value into your decisions. In addition, it is hard to determine what choices depend on your attributes. Otherwise, Sabres of Infinity is a solid read.
